datastructures.trees

Class RedBlackBinarySearchTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastructures.trees.LinkedBinarySearchTree<T>
      • datastructures.trees.RedBlackBinarySearchTree<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element held by the RB_BST.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BinarySearchTree<T>, Tree<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public class RedBlackBinarySearchTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends LinkedBinarySearchTree<T>

    RedBlackBinarySearchTree is a binary tree-based implementation of 2-3 trees. It supports both addition of nodes as well as removal of nodes.

    Since:
    November 2013
    Author:
    Jason Filippou (jasonfil@cs.umd.edu)
    See Also:
    "Algorithms, 4th ed. by Sedgewick and Wayne."

      • isRBBST

        public boolean isRBBST()
                throws EmptyTreeException

        Returns true if the current tree is an RB-BST, false otherwise.

        To answer the question of whether the binary tree is an RB-BST, isRBBST(BSTNode root) checks to see if the tree preserves perfect black balance. The total ordering property can be checked against by checking the node traversals defined for @link{LinkedBinarySearchTree} after removing or adding elements.

        Returns:
        true if the tree is an RB-BST.
        Throws:
        EmptyTreeException - if the tree is empty.
